image.altText: A blurred face of a young boy and a night time crime scene - composite image

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy who was shot dead by police after stabbing a man in Perth on the weekend had physically assaulted another student at his high school a week earlier, it is revealed.

title.children: Teen shot dead by WA police after stabbing attack also involved in high school assault

image.altText: A man in a charcoal suit sitting on a black couch with a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: The former premier tells the National Press Club the current GST system "is no longer fit for purpose", and a new system based on state populations should be implemented.

title.children: Colin Barnett calls for GST system overhaul, after campaigning in office for WA deal

image.altText: A police van on a suburban Safety Bay street.

props.synopsis: Police launch an investigation after a man dies from a stabbing attack in Safety Bay in Perth's south overnight.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigating fatal stabbing attack in Perth's southern suburbs

image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a suit with his head down as another man stands close to him with his hand on his shoulder

props.synopsis: Emotions overflow in court as families of those killed in last year's horrific crash hear driver Brett Button plead guilty to multiple offences as most serious charges are dropped.

title.children: Hunter bus crash driver sobs as he pleads guilty to multiple offences over deaths of 10

image.altText: A gym door that reads "Crunch Fitness, welcome come on in" backwards with police tape.

props.synopsis: A woman in her 30s has been stabbed in the car park of a gym in the suburb of Alexandria, with police now investigating.

title.children: Woman allegedly stabbed by man at Sydney gym car park

image.altText: The sun sets over the chimneys of an oil refinery

props.synopsis: Australia may have just shivered through the coldest April in almost 10 years, but the rest of the world continued to break heat records for the 11th month in a row.

title.children: The world's heat streak continues with April declared the hottest on record

image.altText: A helicopter flying in the air at sunset.

props.synopsis: Beijing shifts its story on the latest confrontation between Chinese and Australian forces, claiming that one of its fighter jets intercepted an Australian helicopter because it was trying to spy on naval exercises in the Yellow Sea.

title.children: China changes story on military confrontation, accuses Australia of spying

image.altText: The outside of a courthouse

props.synopsis: A Broome magistrate says WA's child protection system is ill-equipped to deal with vulnerable children, as he hands down a teen's sentence in court.

title.children: Homeless teenage girl who stole bottle of water avoids penalty as lawyer slams child protection failures

image.altText: The couple stands together in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Debra and Martin Robinson, the parents of Perth brothers Jake and Callum who were killed in Mexico, speak about losing their sons.

title.children: 'The world has become a darker place for us': Parents of murdered Australian brothers pay emotional tribute

image.altText: A photograph of the Kalgoorlie CBD with an inset of a missing man.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the disappearance of a 26-year-old Kalgoorlie man in 1982 has declared him dead after it was told a missing person's report was not filed until 2021.

title.children: Kalgoorlie man declared dead, 42 years after he went missing

image.altText: Multiple tanks at on a desert area witha  city scape in the background.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden has been trying to head off a full-scale assault by the Israelis in Rafah, where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians have sought refuge from combat elsewhere in Gaza.

title.children: US pauses weapons shipment to Israel following IDF occupation of Rafah crossing

image.altText: A group of people standing around a microphone inside a room, in front of an Aboriginal artwork.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners and custodians have welcomed a High Court decision finding Parks Australia can be held criminally liable for allegedly violating a sacred site in Kakadu, saying it will set a precedent for future cases.

title.children: 'It's a proud day': Custodians welcome High Court win in Kakadu sacred site damage case

image.altText: A book titled same-sex parents on a table

props.synopsis: A book, which is recommended for children aged five to seven, at the centre of a controversial ban on same-sex parenting literature by a council in Sydney tells children people "may be unkind" to families who are different and that "it's not OK."

title.children: What's in the same-sex parenting book banned by Western Sydney councillors

image.altText: a man holding a child and hugging a woman

props.synopsis: So-called ISIS bride Mariam Raad faces a potentially lengthy jail term after returning to Australia from Syria.

title.children: ISIS wife who returned to Australia pleads guilty to entering a terrorist-controlled region in Syria

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing a plaid shirt stands in a kitchen and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Lodging complexes are a cost-effective and supportive model of community housing, and there are calls for governments to build more of them in a bid to alleviate the homelessness crisis.

title.children: Robert was a high-flying investment banker but when he lost it all, he needed a lodging house to rebuild his life

image.altText: A Woolworths logo in Adelaide's Rundle Mall

props.synopsis: Thousands of full-time workers at Woolworths may be eligible for a four-day working week if a new enterprise agreement is made and unions sign off on the proposed changes.

title.children: Key union signs off on Woolworths staff four-day work week

image.altText: A man leans on a tree branch looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Five months on from a catastrophic bushfire, fruit growers north of Perth are walking a long road to recovery — but some farmers are also counting their blessings.

title.children: Months after the smoke cleared it's still a long road to recovery for devastated fruit growers

image.altText: A toddler sits on the ground inside a tent, looking on, with his hand over his mouth, while several relatives sit behind

props.synopsis: Aid agencies warn of a humanitarian catastrophe as Israeli forces seize the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing in southern Gaza and close the flow of aid through the checkpoint.

title.children: Gaza aid 'choked off' after Israel seizes Rafah border crossing

image.altText: The frame of a house under construction.

props.synopsis: Thousands of fee-free courses will be offered to boost workers in the construction sector, as the government pledges housing will be a "major focus" of next week's budget to deal with the nation's housing crisis.

title.children: Labor's $90m budget pledge to get workers into housing construction

image.altText: A young man poses for a photo on a cliff face, with mountains behind him.

props.synopsis: The lawyer for Ben Cohen, who was wrongly identified as being the Bondi Junction attacker, says a brief of evidence has been handed to police, identifying "malicious and irresponsible use of social media".

title.children: Sydney student wrongly identified as Westfield attacker wants 'malicious' social media users to be prosecuted

image.altText: David Hutchinson speaks in front of an LNP podium

props.synopsis: A former LNP president who misused $500,000 in Morrison government grant money is ordered to pay costs after ousting a business partner who expressed concerns, a federal judge rules.

title.children: 'Abuse of process': Judge criticises ex-LNP president after $5.5m government grant

image.altText: Middle-aged woman smiles and rests her chin on her hands. She wears diamond rings on her fingers and and diamond earrings

props.synopsis: Terry was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease in her 50s. This is her daughter's message to anyone going through the same experience.

title.children: The 'strange' behaviours that led to Terry's dementia diagnosis at age 54

image.altText: A crayon sketch depicting a woman in a suit sitting in a court room stand with a judge looking down at her

props.synopsis: The former adult film star offers jurors a graphic account of an alleged sexual encounter with the former US president she says she was paid to be quiet about.

title.children: Stormy Daniels gives graphic account of sexual encounter with Trump during hush money trial

image.altText: Parked cars line the streets of inner city Melbourne suburbs.

props.synopsis: From wealth to housing, health and environment — see how hundreds of regions across the country compare when it comes to wellbeing.

title.children: How liveable is your city? Here's our interactive map revealing Australia's best regions

image.altText: Side by side photos of the Treasurer Jim Chalmers looking serious and Michele Bullock, gesturing with her hand mid-speech

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers is downplaying any difference between his view of the economy and that of Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock after the RBA sounded a pessimistic note on inflation.

title.children: Do the treasurer and the RBA governor agree on the economy? 'More or less'

image.altText: A woman takes a photograph of illuminated cherry blossoms in full bloom

props.synopsis: Visitor numbers are up more than 10 per cent compared to pre-pandemic levels with a combination of a weak yen, the relaxation of coronavirus restrictions and "revenge travel" making Japan one of the world's hottest destinations.

title.children: 'We're not a theme park': Japan asks visitors to show respect amid a tourism boom

image.altText: A bald man sits at a table in front of a computer

props.synopsis: Some of UniSuper's 630,000 members are losing sleep over whether they have lost their money put away for retirement as the superannuation company's outage enters its 7th day.

title.children: UniSuper members worried about retirement funds as week-long outage continues

image.altText: Two young people sit on the ground in handcuffs while a third is laying down while being arrested. Police stand nearby.

props.synopsis: Youth crime has been hitting the headlines, but what does the long-term data show? An analysis of crime data shows offender rates have risen for the first time in 14 years, as Australia wrestles with how to manage children who are both victims and criminals.

title.children: 'We're losing a generation of kids' as youth offender rates increase for first time in more than a decade

image.altText: Small glass vial with label reading Astra Zeneca sits on bench next to a syringe

props.synopsis: AstraZeneca has initiated the worldwide withdrawal of its COVID-19 vaccine, Vaxzevria, which is no longer being manufactured or supplied, the company said.

title.children: AstraZeneca withdraws COVID-19 vaccine, cites a decline in demand

image.altText: An old film photo of Danielle Snelling and mum (Rosa); they wear white and smile to the camera.

props.synopsis: Seeing pictures and messages of people celebrating Mother's Day online can be difficult for those who have lost a mum or a child, are experiencing infertility, or have a strained relationship with their mum.

title.children: Danielle was 23 when she lost her mum. Here's how she takes care online around Mother's Day

image.altText: Illuminated logos of Coles and Woolworths outside of each supermarket in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: New survey data shows tanking public trust in the Coles and Woolworths brands in the wake of regulatory and government inquiries and the rise in the cost of living.

title.children: Public trust in Coles, Woolworths dives as cost of living pressures rise

image.altText: Four people walk along a footpath in front of the ASX building on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is trading slightly higher on Wednesday after the RBA's latest interest rate decision, while Wall Street's recent rally loses steam as investors wait for the latest inflation data out of the US next week. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises as post-RBA momentum continues despite 'underwhelming' session on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Millions pledged to cover fee-free TAFE to get more workers into housing construction
Chalmers 'more or less' on the same page as RBA sounds inflation warning
Unions torn on four-day work week agreement for thousands of Woolworths staff

image.altText: A person in a white gown stands next to a person playing the yakidi who stands next to a person playing the keyboards

props.synopsis: Australia's Electric Fields won't be progressing to the next stage of the song content but the duo already made history by stepping on the hallowed stage.

title.children: 'I feel very proud': Australia is out of Eurovision 2024 but Electric Fields still made history
